oh oh yea, and wednesday I dropped my bach on the concrete ground, smashing the bell up real nice.  definitely worthy of the charles of the year

after quick consideration but not much to back it up (yet), I've decided that girls are much more spiteful than boys... but I may be wrong.
when you override your logic where do you turn? especially when there wasn't much logic in the first place.

"brave? I'm mush in your hands, and you know that"

weird eh!?!

thanks mike rice... his explanation for why I'm miserable in school all the time.

and boy am I miserable.  I hate school so much. and after that bullshit "we think everyone is getting sick from post-hurricane trama" I really can't stand it.  I'm about to freak out.

aside from all the responsibilities I hate (everyone of them) I'm pretty happy.

Well I'm updating, but not because my house got power back, nope that's still out (poor guys).  I'm in NY and Jenna happens to have one of those portable computer things! WOWWW with a wireless connection.  you're probably wondering though, if I'm in NY, why am I sitting on the computer.  

this is the weirdest thing I've ever experienced.  During their lunch hour, I saw like... 10 people from my old school.. (basically my entire grade).  Kids I haven't seen in 4 years.  I mean, sure I've seen Josh since I moved, but everyone else (aside from a glance from the last time i visited) I haven't seen really.  Casey for instance...omg weirdest thing ever... I couldn't believe it.  They all like flocked in a sense says my brother.  So here's all these kids I grew up with, from the time I was like 4 until i was maybe 11.  People I've totally lost touch with but used to see every day.  I'm walking around this town and many things are the same, even though my memory is a bit jogged.  It's eerie, and I merely feel unwelcome.  I almost want to pick up where I was before I got here, not really talking to any of them and just leave.. and never have to deal with it again.  It's really awkward and really crazy... completely surreal.

as for the hurricane (the previous not the damn freakin' next one).  it was ok.. not too much damage.  lost a tree or 2, one down on our powerline.  No power since Friday... it was crazy.  We had many people in our small house, including: my parents, josh, jamin, sarah, myself, charlie, zach, eric, dj, and ashley.  Holy MANY people with a complete lack of fresh air during that hurricane.  Eric was tweekin out.  We all woke up in the middle of the night and after he was awake for like 45 minutes he was breaking out in like hives begging for fresh air and a ciggarette.  It was absolutely rediculous.  Much puking on their parts (4 of them, completely out of the norm).  It wasn't bad though.  I've gotten pretty mellow, so I was never really freaking out despite the lack of oxygen (though my head did start to spin by the end of one night, wow that was awful), space, hygene.. so on.. the hurricane was neat.. strong, FREEZING wind.  Eric and zach went out in the strongest part, driving I mean.. idiots..

so now I went from basically living with the boy for 5 days to not seeing him at all... it's extremely weird.

everything is weird right now.  feels like life has stopped in it's tracks.

but as for why I'm not out enjoying myself in this booming town (sarcasim).  the 4 of us (josh, me, eric, and colette) all fell asleep (long drive).  I woke up, walked around for a bit.  and then came back in.  everyone i know is a soccer practice right now.  i may go crash it in a bit.

entirely too long... bye.  be safe.

tonight was a good night, seemed to calm down about everything...  not as anxious about this hurricane, maybe because right now it's weaker then it has been.  even if it does come right for us, we're prepared.. lots of supplies and such, and basically everyone will be here, and that's good, I'm glad the people I care about most will be in the same house as me.

reassured today. so far everything is good, nearly earily good.  3 weeks today and neither of us are fickle, we actually both seem pretty happy.. but being that I dont want to screw that up with my words, I'll shut up. fact is: for today, it was good.  who knows what tomorrow will bring, but today it's good.  still trips me out that I've had this boyfriend for three weeks.

as a matter of fact:
i hope EVERYONE is safe and happy.
I miss bradley jo.
I miss tiffany lee.

I'm all on edge, everything..
freakin' this hurricane, I wasn't too worried, you know, haven't been through a hurricane ever so it didn't or doesn't seem to real.. and now I'm reading all these live journals, and talking to people taht are close to me that HAVE been through hurricanes.  everyone leaving, and saying be safe and shit... I'm freaking out.  I dont want to stay here and just watch everything fall to peices.  but even if I did leave, the closest people in my life won't leave.  "the surf will be so perfect after it passes.  and I dont care if I die, I'll be wasted anyway."  even if I was gone, I'd be so scared that their dumbasses weren't ok.  I just try not to think about it, but then I feel like I'm not giving it the credit and thought it actually does deserve, you can't just ignor everything and if this is as severe as they're planning for it to be...you really wouldn't be able to ignor it.

aside from that, adding to edgy-ness.. sort've an awkard night.  it started off good.  really good.  I was just having a really good time.  then I said something that was way more offensive then I ever ment to be (oblivious not spiteful) and whoa holy freakin mood swing.  then it fell back into ok.. but a different sort've mood.  before it was super funny and fun, and then it was just sort've quite and close.. and it took a while for everything to seem comfortable again.  then, eventhough it got good again, the end was sort've awkward... tried to pass it off like it wasn't, but I got the feeling that it was.  and being that I know how I am, I know that just little things can knock your head out of it.. it's just such a freaky situation, with so many different angles playing into it, from every damn side.  and though it was working more from one side earlier, there's been a dramatic switch which won't subside until I see it all in action again the next day, all the same as usual.  but I'm affraid it wont be. not my main concern though.  main concern is this huge freakin hurricane coming right at us.

that's right, as everyone in my grade is looking forward to turning 17 soon enough, I'm content with finally being 16.  that's right everyone, the big 1-6.  it was a good birthday, sort've uneventful, but good.  I went to school, had some band before and after, then came home.. fell asleep for a little bit listening to some jazz.  charlie showed up, we got some smoothies, visited the river, and went to publix then came back and waited for dinner.  chicken fingers :) yessss.. by request.  opened some presents, ate some cake.
what'd I get:
6 dvds 
2 stuffed animals
little chocolate
a bookmark.. which my dad picked out heh
$40
flowers :)
candy from megan (holy sweetest girl ever... seriously)
and of course my good ol 2002 honda civic

things I'm looking fowards to now that my birthday has passed:
going to NY next thursday
getting my license sometime after october 2nd

trying to keep my head up, I feel sort've sad right now.  but things are good :)

now is when I will succumb to the band inside me:

we had a good party, or atleast I think so and that's what counts right?

but serious, I was super bummed about all the seniors leaving, I thought our entire section unity and all that crap would just go out the door and we'd lose all of our spunk and such.  but now they're gone, and yea we may not be the section that everyone thinks is the funniest or anything anymore but I feel bunches closer to everyone in that section.  it's not like a couple guys being the center of attention all the time and putting everyone else down to get a good laugh (eventhough they really were good laughs).  I really enjoy everyone in our section, it's great.  gives a girl that warm fuzzy feeling in side that she's always searching for.  

our night included:
-everyone swimming (except tim and I) and being super crazy
-derek, osiel, and javier backing away from me like I had the plague
-the boys breaking one of those light bulbs trying to get tim's other shoe off
-an INTENSE tornado warning
-some crazy word game for hours (including "prophylactic" which amanda's mom was trying to see if she could get any of us to guess.  she assumed I'd be able to get it, which was at first a super low blow, ESPECIALLY because I'd never met her before) but then she said it was because I seemed to be the smartest of the bunch, yess...)
-great, arcade style, q*bert (hell yea)
-javi sniffing my hair while I was playing q*bert
-a toilet running into the hallway, me stepping in the water, and proceeding to put my feet on random people :)
-mucho more

what a band entry.. gay

boy, I can feel my heart coming through my skin... or that's sort've what it feels like.  sort've ironic being that jon christo is out in my livingroom.. ironic because you can always see his heart beating I guess, I want to see that, I bet it looks pretty freaky.

so we're coming home from band pictures (ryan, sarah, and I), and we turn and we pass this little kid with no shirt on and ryan was liek "he looks lost" and sarah was like "yea and I think he was crying.."  well as it goes she ends up having ryan turn around.. and he makes this huge dramatic u-turn.  so we start going back towards the kid, and he's turned around and has started walking the other way, pretty fast too.  then he looks back, and starts a steady run.. then he looks back again and bam-full on sprint, like a lightening bolt, never seen a kid run so fast.  then we realize: he's running away from us!  we probably tramatized him for life!  he looked sooo scared, scarred for life... :( I was real upset. it was awful.  

...but really funny at the same time.

it's really awkward.  I was thinking about this one time when I was younger, in elementry school, and school was delayed because of snow (they had to put chains on the tires of the buses).  and I was talking to my mom and she told me to brush my teeth again because my breath smelled bad I guess.  so I did.

but that got me thinking, about how that seems like such a long time ago..because it was... but it doesnt' seem real anymore.  then I realized that nothing really seems real from ny anymore.  old best friends that I dont talk to anymore, an entire life that I dont have at all anymore.  they cycle even started in fl, best friends that I dont talk to anymore, not being able to decide what was a dream and what was real.  mind you my memory is awful.  just weird that things I was living, that were completely real, are completely dream-like now.  I'm not complaining so much as just realizing.  it's.. weird.

life is a freaky little thing.

in a hundred more ways than one.

I guess that'd be 101 eh?

"he's home? ::awful scared face:: he got fired??????"
"...umm no..lunch" 

hahahaha first instinct hahahaha

but.. I deleted it.. sorry Jill, but I dont want to hear shit from people.. and you know people, they really like feces.  but anyway, it was just me agreeing with you and then going off and just rambling.  went from teenage girl-highschool-people being stupid-"relationships"-good ol' boyfriend-me being crazy-the end.  something sorta like that.

freaking amazing.  we're freakin amazing, that's all I gotta say.  except for right there, he was flat...but this song sucks anyway.  ahhhh flat again, same part, different place and flat AGAIN!  stupid song.

it's friday
Mr. Hinkle randomly gave me the solo in In The Mood, I dont know why
I frantically took off my shirt on the way home from school in a fit of heat

reasons why today is stupid:
I have HOMEWORK 
and entirely too much
who knows if I'll be able to play that solo
no plans
homework

here's the best news in the world: I'm going to to texas in 2 weeks!

too bad it's not true. HEH

that was fun, school has kicked the good ol' trickery BACK INTO MY BONES!  (pronounced "Ma'bonesss"

bye

"you just have a whatever-kind-of-day-you-want-to tomorrow jade tcimpidis."

well you guys, it's offical, I'm a completely pessimistic lazy piece of crap.  I hate school so much, I'm miserable there.  and I dont want to go to band.  and anything with the slightest bit of responsibility i dont want to do.  that's it, I'm dropping out.  but seriously... I hope these beginning of the school year blues atleast lessen in some sense because if not.. I'm gonna be one miserable little girl.  got any tips for some optimisim?!  my heads gonna explode, I'm kicking my own ass.

however, EVERYTHING isn't miserable.  (though it all has its little tastes of crap which I'm sure will only increase as it seeps out!)

it is the last night of summer, and I really didn't do much...at all.  no i didn't do anything.  but last night was a lot of fun and tonight ended nicely.  and while summer IS ending.., new beginnings definitely have begun, and distractions help get you through school! for sure.  I am still anticipating the distractions, seems the tables have turned though, for now.  

on my tv, everyone is admitting they're gay to save some guy's job, and it's very cute. "i'm howards styles, and i'm gay ::rip:: and I'm bald" there goes the whole fire department, oops and the band, and yupp everyones standing up..  ohh man and a terrible sounding band it is.

I don't care about your opinion.  I only care about the truth that you acquire and I've failed to see, or even just ignored.  So tell me if I'm wrong, tell me something I don't know, I'd be more than greatful to obtain that knowledge, then I'll form my own opinion. 

I just want the primary sources.
last night of summer... i want ice cream.
it's 8:13 in the morning and I've already been up for over 2 hours, nearly 3.  REDICULOUS... but funny. heh. no band and I'm still up.

I'm gonna miss you







a lot.

it's starting again.  i hate it when it's like this.  seems redundant, constant cycle sort of thing.

I laughed a bunch today, I think my stomach actually sorta hurts from it.

going school shopping tomorrow.. trying to get in that shopping mood, because it's not my favorite thing.. and I'm not really looking forward to it so much.  hopefully she's in a good mood, positive and stuff.

how do you get away from something that feels completely right, but those who you truley trust and are most knowledgeable "know" it's not.

I guess I need out of it all before I actually even get in.

everything in me is pulling towards it, but I think that may just be a magnetic field or something... FUCK

and I'm weak.

my will power ranks at none.

when you can't seem to find any music to fit your mood.  everything hits you the wrong way, and every thought is seemingly dissatisfying.  it'd be easy if I could just have you tell me where I take the wrong turn in my thought process, and I could do the same for you, slap hands, and we'd be done..on our ways.  and on these ways, the cheery music WOULD fit our mood, and we'd go off smiling.. scary thing is after we've exchanged these clues that are suposed to fix everything, we may not know more, but rather ignor more.  because, as the saying goes, ignorance is bliss, and aint that the truth.

go ahead.  try to be a little more optimistic.  "be optimistic, dont get grumpy, when the road gets bumpy just smile smile smile"  ignor those bumps buddy.  and try to remember that despite how barren and ugly the road is, your exit will come.  

OH THE ANALOGIES!  I wish I could show my mood throughout this entry.  I dont think I like it... "it" representing this entry.  sorry guys.

and can't do a thing about it.  it's surrounded by bulletproof glass.  I can see it cleary so I know it's there, but I have no way of getting it.  but then I even go as far to question whether it's  just an illusion, and I'm not talking about the glass, just the entire thing all together.  it wouldn't surprise me and would probably disappoint me less...definitely would.

damnit..

I'm now anticipating the distractions.

to New York in September.  and get this: I dont miss a day of band.  I'm excited.

dinner's almost done..and for the time being, I'm more excited about that.

Leadership camp was fun (even if I battled with my antisocial side the entire time); however, I am glad to be home.

I'm glad I just did that.  not even so much glad, it wasn't something I was struggling over to say the least, I assumed I would (I was looking forward to it), but.. well yea glad, I enjoyed it.  Infact, I wish I was still doing it, but eh... ya gotta let em' go right?...

...right?

We're going to start a lobotomy ranch, full of lucious boys ready for lovin' and nothing else (hense lobotomy.. they'll basically be sex-potatoes).

http://www.lobotomy.info/adventures.html, there's a little history on the good ol' lobotomy.

...and learning, on your own grounds, is also interesting.
they're the greatest people I could ever know!

"...Her six-year-old son, Alex, was infected with the bug in July of 1993 after eating a tainted hamburger.  His illness began with abdominal cramps that seemed as severe as labor pains.  It progressed to diarrhea that filled a hospital toilet with blood.  Doctors frantically tried to save Alex's life, drilling holes in his skill to relieve pressure, inserting tubes in his chest to keep him breathing, as the Shiga toxins destroyed internal organs.  "I would have done anything to save my son's life," Donley says. "I would have run in front of a bus to save Alex."  Instead, she stood and watched helplessly as he called out for her, terrified and in pain.  He became ill on a Tuesday night, the night after his mother's birthday, and was dead by Sunday afternoon.  Toward the end, Alex suffered hallucinations and dementia, no longer recognizing his mother or father.  Portions of his brain had been liquefied. "The sheer brutality of his death was horrifying," Donley says."

"It is a civilization which has destroyed the simplicity and repose of life; replaced it's contenetment, it's poetry, it's soft romantic dreams and visions with the money fever, sorid ideals, vulgar ambitions, and the sleep which does not refresh..."

sorid?

last night my mom asked me if I remember George Valentine.  I said "sure, of course.  he owned valentine park and gave out quarter for halloween."  and she was like, "yea, well he had like 8 different women, and SEVERAL children.. like 32, with all the different women... you remember misha?  well she was one of his girlfriends.  I talked to a couple of his wives, 4 of them maybe, and they all said the same thing, 'that's George, it's who I fell in love with, and if it was anything different, then he wouldn't be the same George I fell in love with.' none of them liked it really, but none of them would change it."  aint that somethin, that guy lived down the street from me..32 kids

there's a sobe bottle on my desk.  It's got about an inch left.  Yesturday, I asked if it was his, he said it was and that he'd move it, yet..it's still there.  OH WELL.  He's probably the best actor I know.
